text: The 1935- 36 Austrian football championship was organized by the Vienna Football Association and contested by its members. The two-tiered Second League served as the lower tier of the First League. These leagues were open only to professional football clubs. Other Austrian state associations organized regional championships in various amateur formats. The respective amateur state champions competed for a champion in the Amateur Championship. 1. Wiener Neustädter SC became amateur champion. ==Mode == The First League championship was contested by 12 teams. Each of the teams met twice throughout the season. SK Admira Wien became Austrian football champions for the fifth time. ==Final table== Table mode (in case of equal points): 1st criterion goal quotient Pl. Name M W D L P 1\. FK Austria Wien 22 8 4 10 20 8\. Favoritner AC 22 9 1 12 19 9\. Floridsdorfer AC 22 6 4 12 160,85 10\. Libertas Wien 22 6 4 12 160,80 11\. SC Hakoah Wien 22 6 3 13 15 12\. 17 May 1936 Wiener Sport-Club SC Wacker Wien 1-1 27 May 1936 SC Hakoah Wien SK Admira Wien 3-2 27 May 1936 First Vienna FC SK Rapid Wien 2-1 28 May 1936 FK Austria Wien FC Libertas Wien 0-0 The original game on May 28, 1936, was canceled due to rain. After both sides expressed no interest in rescheduling this match (Libertas went on tour immediately after May 28, 1936), the match was officially played on July 13, 1936, with a 0-0 result and 0 points for both teams. ===Round 22=== Date Team 1 Team2 7 April 1936 SK Admira Wien Wiener AC 7-2 After five minutes, the score was already 5-0.
